text: East Houston Station Post Office East Houston is a community in Houston, Texas, United States. ==Government and infrastructure== The City of Houston Super Neighborhood #49 East Houston opened on August 24, 2000."Super Neighborhood # 49 - East Houston." City of Houston. Retrieved on December 4, 2008. The United States Postal Service operates the East houston Post Office at 9604 Mesa Drive."Post Office Location - EAST HOUSTON ." United States Postal Service. Retrieved on December 4, 2008. In July 2011 the USPS announced that the post office may close.Weisman, Laura. "Nine Houston post offices marked for closure (with poll)." Houston Chronicle. July 26, 2011. Retrieved on July 26, 2011. ==Education== The Houston Independent School District serves East Houston.Barajas, Erik. "North Forest ISD officially closes today ." KTRK- TV. July 1, 2013. Retrieved on July 1, 2013. North Forest High School is the sole zoned high school. Until July 1, 2013, North Forest Independent School District served East Houston; that district was formerly named the East and Mount Houston Independent School District."The History of B.C. Elmore." ( ) B.C. Elmore Middle School. Retrieved on November 14, 2011. ==References== Category:Neighborhoods in Houston
title: East Houston, Houston
